intro: Nectris caroliniana, commonly known as the Carolina nectris, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Nectris caroliniana thrives in wetlands and marshy areas, often growing in dense colonies.
